meanings.definition: To fill or overpower with terror; terrify.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm would terrorise the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie had the power to terrorise the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to terrorise the big dog, but ended up getting scared itself.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house seemed to terrorise even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the dark forest could terrorise anyone who dared to enter.

meanings.definition: To dominate or coerce by intimidation.
meanings.sent1: The bully would terrorise the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The dictator used fear to terrorise the citizens into submission.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to terrorise the big dog, but ended up getting scared itself.
meanings.sent4: The aggressive competitor aimed to terrorise the other players with their skills.
meanings.sent5: The imposing presence of the mountain seemed to terrorise the surrounding landscape.
